p: Additionally, Kouji Ohnishi et al. [ 67] introduced a non-prime site substituent at the 4-position carbon of the decahydroisoqunolin skeleton to yield the nonpeptidic inhibitor 38, which exhibits moderate but enhanced inhibitory activity against R188I SARS 3CL pro (IC 50 = 26 μM). The results indicated significantly increased affinity between 38 and SARS 3CL pro at the S3 to S4 pockets.
